problem: A 60 g arrow is fired from a bow whose string exerts an average force of 100N on the arrow over a distance of 80cm. (a) What is the speed of the arrow as it leaves the bow? (b) What is the power given to the arrow?

variables.meaning: distance over which string force acts
pressure of average value delivered to arrow

correctFormulas.name: Work to kinetic energy
correctFormulas.formula: W = F₍avg₎ d = ½ m v²

correctFormulas.name: Constant-acceleration relations
correctFormulas.formula: a = F₍avg₎ / m,   v² = 2 a d,   t = v / a

steps.explanation: Compute the acceleration and final speed using kinematics/work-energy.
Work done equals F d (=80 J) and determines the kinetic energy.
Find the time interval and the corresponding average power.
